sentences.english: The ground parched and cracked is like overbaked bread.
sentences.chinese: 地面干裂如烤焦的面包。

sentences.english: Put red peppers in a pan and burn their skin on low fire.
sentences.chinese: 把整个红椒放到平底锅里，用小火慢慢将皮烤焦。

sentences.english: The cat got her tail singed through sitting too near the fire.
sentences.chinese: 猫坐得太靠近炉火，尾巴上的毛被烤焦了。

sentences.english: You can add a little water at the bottom of the pan so the apples don't burn.
sentences.chinese: 如果怕苹果底下会烤焦，可以在烤盘里放一点点水。

sentences.english: Around the great fountain, the earth was already dried up to the point of being burnt.
sentences.chinese: 大水池周围，地干得象是烤焦了一样。

sentences.english: Russia has been scorched by heatwave and its forests incinerated.
sentences.chinese: 俄罗斯已经被热浪烤焦，森森已经化为灰烬。

sentences.english: The burnt toast bread smelled up the whole room.
sentences.chinese: 吐司面包烤焦了，整个房间都充满了焦味。

sentences.english: The wall-ring was blackened and twisted like a burnt bannock.
sentences.chinese: 墙上的铁环象烤焦的薄饼，变黑了，扭曲变形。

sentences.english: Meat is basted to keep it from drying out and to improve its flavour.
sentences.chinese: 烤肉时润以脂油使不致烤焦并可增加香味。

sentences.english: Heat oil for searing the steak in a large no tick skillet over high heat.
sentences.chinese: 为在高的热上一个大的非根煮锅中烤焦牛排加热油。

sentences.english: The handle seared his palm like a cattle brand.
sentences.chinese: 把手烤焦了他的手掌，留下一个牛脚般的烙印。

sentences.english: Turn down the fire. The steak is burned.
sentences.chinese: 把火关小一点，牛排已经被烤焦了。

sentences.english: Seared in the fiery furnace of this world.
sentences.chinese: 在这个世界的炽热熔炉内被烤焦。

sentences.english: The scorched couch is put in the porch of epoch.
sentences.chinese: 被烤焦的睡椅放在时代门廊内。

sentences.english: The burnt toast smelled up the whole house.
sentences.chinese: 面包烤焦了，整个房子都充满了焦味。

definition: to scorch/(of the sun) to beat down on
to smoke/to cure over a wood fire
a burn (tissue damage from heat, chemicals etc)/to burn (the skin etc)/(fig.) (of anger, jealousy etc) to hurt (sb)
to discharge smoke/to fume with rage
to smoke/to fumigate/to assail the nostrils/to perfume
fragrance/warm/to educate/variant of 熏[xun1]/to smoke/to fumigate
